question: [File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [arb_transit_sign_response] [Signature malleability] Does the fuzzer test for signature malleability where multiple valid signatures exist for the same message, enabling transaction replay? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [All functions with String parameters] [Unicode normalization] Can Unicode normalization attacks cause identical-looking but different strings to bypass comparison checks in secret/key lookups? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [All functions with String parameters] [String length DoS] Can extremely long strings in names, tokens, or signatures cause buffer allocation failures or performance degradation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [All functions with String parameters] [Null byte injection] Can null bytes in strings truncate validation checks while preserving malicious suffixes that get executed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [All arb_ functions] [404 vs 403 confusion] Can ambiguous 404 status codes (not found vs no permission) leak information about secret existence for unauthorized enumeration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [All arb_ functions] [Redirect status codes] Are 3xx redirect status codes properly rejected, or can they be exploited to redirect sensitive Vault operations to attacker-controlled servers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [All arb_ functions] [429 rate limit] Does fuzzing test rate limit responses (429) to ensure validators don't leak timing information during denial of service conditions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [arb_secret_read_response] [Metadata consistency] Can metadata (created_time, version) be inconsistent with actual secret data, causing validators to trust outdated or tampered secrets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [arb_transit_read_key] [Timestamp rollback] Can creation_time timestamps be rolled back to cause key versioning confusion and force use of compromised historical keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [Functions using BTreeMap] [Ordering attacks] Can BTreeMap ordering be manipulated through carefully crafted keys to cause unexpected key selection in version lookups? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [Functions using BTreeMap] [Key collision] Can BTreeMap key collisions (u32 version numbers) cause one key to overwrite another, enabling key substitution attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [Functions with Vec collections] [Order dependency] Do processing functions incorrectly assume collection ordering, allowing attackers to manipulate security by reordering elements? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [Functions with Vec collections] [Empty collection bypass] Can empty vectors bypass validation checks, causing operations to succeed incorrectly with no data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [All arb_ functions] [Malformed JSON structure] Can the fuzzer generate responses with extra fields that processing functions silently ignore, potentially hiding attack payloads? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [All arb_ functions] [Missing required fields] Does fuzzing test responses where required fields are missing, ensuring processing functions fail safely rather than using default values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [All arb_ functions] [Type mismatch fields] Can fields have incorrect types (e.g., string instead of number) that exploit lenient JSON parsing to bypass validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [Test module] [Test isolation] Are proptest executions properly isolated, or can state pollution between test cases cause false negatives where vulnerabilities are masked? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [Test module] [Seed predictability] Can proptest seed values be predicted or manipulated to avoid testing specific vulnerability-triggering input combinations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [process_generic_response_proptest] [Buffer re-use attack] Does the explicit buffer clearing in process_generic_response adequately prevent data leakage when HTTP connections are reused? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [process_policy_read_response_proptest] [Policy parsing bypass] Can fuzzing reveal ways to craft policies with malicious rules that bypass authorization checks in Vault? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [process_transit_restore_response_proptest] [Key restoration attack] Can malicious restore responses cause validators to restore compromised keys that should have been revoked? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [arb_token_renew_response] [Lease duration arithmetic] Can lease_duration arithmetic overflow when calculating token expiration times, granting permanent access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [arb_secret_read_response] [Version increment overflow] If version (u32) reaches u32::MAX, can it overflow back to 0, causing version confusion and security downgrades? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [arb_transit_read_response] [Version u32 limits] Can version number exhaustion (reaching u32::MAX versions) cause denial of service by preventing new key versions from being created? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/vault/src/fuzzing.rs] [Overall architecture] [Fuzzing completeness] Does the fuzzing module test all possible error paths and failure modes in Vault response processing, or are there untested code paths that could hide vulnerabilities? (High)
